markdownRemark.html:
Ingredients

Safeway

  • 1 pound chocolate chip cookie dough (or any cookie recipe you want)
  • 1.5 cups semisweet chocolate chips
  • 1 teaspoon peanut or vegetable oil
  • 2 (1 1/2 ounces) chocolate-toffee candy bars, chopped into 1/4-inch pieces
  • 2 medium bananas, peeled and sliced into 1/4-inch rounds
  • 1 pint vanilla or banana ice cream, softened

Cooking Instructions

    400°F
  1. Place an oven rack in the center of the oven. Preheat the oven to 325°F.
  2. Form the cookie dough into 12 equal-sized balls and place on an ungreased baking sheet. Bake for 16 to 18 minutes until lightly browned around the edges.
  3. Cool for 10 minutes. Transfer the cookies to a wire rack to cool completely, about 20 minutes.
  4. In a small bowl, toss together the chocolate chips and oil.
  5. Place the bowl over a pan of simmering water and stir until the chocolate has melted and the mixture is smooth, about 3 to 5 minutes.
  6. Spread the melted chocolate on top of 6 of the cooled cookies. Place on a parchment or waxed paper-lined baking sheet.
  7. Sprinkle the chocolate-toffee candy pieces on top of the melted chocolate. Place the remaining cookies, flat-side-up, on the same baking sheet.
  8. Arrange the banana slices in a single layer on the flat side of the remaining cookies.
  9. Freeze all the cookies for 45 to 60 minutes until the chocolate has set and the banana slices are frozen.
  10. Using an ice cream scoop, scoop about 1/3 cup softened ice cream on top of the frozen bananas.
  11. Place a chocolate covered cookie on top and gently press to form a sandwich. Repeat with the remaining ice cream and cookies. Freeze for 3 to 4 hours until firm.

frontmatter.title: Banana Ice Cream Sandwiches
frontmatter.description: This post is related to the gatsbyjs
frontmatter.recipeIntroParagraph: Given the name of this recipe, I figured I was making some sort of variation of a deep-dish pizza. After looking through the ingredients and actually cooking the pie, I realized this wasn't a pizza at all. I'm doing my online research as I'm writing this, and I'm finding that this is a traditional Italian Easter dish which would make a lot of sense. It has a lot of cheese, flavorful Italian sausage, a fantastic crust, and no pizza sauce or anything like that. It was incredible as a dinner and I'm sure it would be awesome at Easter brunch as well.
